title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving

text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Renewable 

Energy) (Amendment) Regulations 2024. 

Interpretation

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

“Principal Regulations” means the European Union (Renewable Energy) 
Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 365 of 2020). 

Amendment to Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations
text_norm: 2 regulation - principal regulation mean european union (renewable energy) regulation 2020 (s.i no 365 2020) amendment regulation 2 principal regulation

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: 3. (1) Regulation 2(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by: -
text_raw:
3. (1) Regulation 2(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by: - 

(a) 

the insertion of the following definition after the definition of 
biomass: 

““Commission Regulation” means Commission Regulation (EU) 
651/2014 of 17 June 2014 declaring certain categories of aid 
compatible with the internal market in application of Articles 107 
and 108 of the Treaty, as amended by Commission Regulation 
(EU) 2023/1315 of 23 June 2023.” 

(b) 

substituting the definition of “small scale installations” for the 
following: 

“small scale installations” means - 

(i) 

projects for electricity generation or storage from 
renewable energy sources with installed capacity below or 
equal to 1 MW, 

(ii) 

for renewable energy communities projects, 100 % SMEowned projects and demonstration projects – projects from 

1 OJ No. L 328, 21.12.2018, p. 82 
2 OJ No. L 187, 26.6.2014, p.1 
3 OJ No. L 167, 30.6.2023, p.1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 10th January, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [755] 3 

renewable energy sources below or equal to 6 MW installed 
capacity or maximum demand, and 

(iii) 

 for renewable energy communities projects and projects 
100 % owned by micro or small enterprises – projects for 
wind generation only below or equal to 18 MW of installed 
capacity; 

(2) The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation 

2(2) the following: 

“(2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and is also used in 
the Directive or the Commission Regulation has, unless the context otherwise 
requires the same meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Directive, or as 
the case may be the Commission Regulation.” 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 
19 December, 2024. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for the Environment, 
Climate and Communications. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [755]

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend and expand the definition of “small scale installations” 
as set out in S.I. No. 365/2020 to bring it up to date with Article 43 (2) of 
Regulation (EU) 2023/1315 “GBER”. These Regulations provide for projects 
operating at the capacities targeted in the Small-Scale Renewable Electricity 
Support Scheme (SRESS). 

 
 
 
 
 
 [755] 5
